## ğŸ“± Reddit Templates

### r/privacy
```
Title: [Tool] Free & Open-Source 1Password to Apple Passwords Migrator

I created a tool to help people migrate from 1Password to Apple Passwords without data loss.

**Why this matters for privacy:**
- Apple Passwords is free and privacy-focused (E2E encryption, on-device processing)
- No subscriptions = less financial tracking
- Open source = audit the code yourself
- Keeps your data out of third-party tools

**What it exports:**
- All passwords with TOTP/2FA codes
- Credit cards, secure notes, identities
- File attachments
- Works offline (no cloud processing)

The tool is MIT licensed, uses only Python standard library (no sketchy dependencies), and works on all platforms.

GitHub: [link]

Would love feedback from the community! Also happy to answer technical questions.
```

### r/selfhosted
```
Title: 1Password to Apple Passwords Exporter - Open Source Migration Tool

Made a Python script to help people migrate from 1Password to Apple's free Passwords app.

Features:
- Exports .1pux files to Apple Passwords CSV format
- Preserves ALL data (passwords, TOTP, cards, notes, attachments)
- Cross-platform (Mac/Windows/Linux)
- Zero external dependencies (pure Python stdlib)
- MIT licensed

Perfect for:
- Escaping subscription fatigue
- Apple ecosystem users
- Backing up password vaults
- Anyone wanting self-hosted password storage

Code: [GitHub link]

Tested with vaults of 1000+ items. Takes ~5 minutes total.
```

## ğŸ¬ Hacker News

### Show HN Post
```
Title: Show HN: Free Tool to Migrate from 1Password to Apple Passwords

URL: [GitHub link]

With Apple Passwords now free in macOS 15+ and iOS 18+, many are looking to switch from paid password managers like 1Password ($36-60/year).

The problem: No official migration tool exists, and manual CSV export loses data (TOTP codes, attachments, structured data).

I built a Python script that:
- Parses 1Password's .1pux export format
- Converts to Apple Passwords-compatible CSV
- Extracts all attachments and non-password items
- Preserves TOTP/2FA codes
- Works on any platform with Python 3.6+

It's MIT licensed, uses only standard library (no dependencies), and handles large vaults (tested with 1000+ items).

The whole migration takes ~5 minutes: Export from 1Password â†’ Run script â†’ Import to Apple Passwords.

Happy to answer questions about the .1pux format, Apple Passwords CSV requirements, or the implementation!
```

---

## ğŸ’¡ Pro Tips

1. **Best Times to Post:**
   - Twitter/X: 8-10 AM, 5-7 PM EST
   - LinkedIn: Tue-Thu, 9 AM - 12 PM
   - Reddit: Depends on subreddit

2. **Don't Be Spammy:**
   - Wait 3+ months between posts to same community
   - Add value in comments
   - Respond to all questions

3. **Engage Authentically:**
   - Answer questions thoroughly
   - Thank users for feedback
   - Be helpful, not salesy

4. **Cross-Promote:**
   - Share YouTube video on Twitter
   - Embed tweets in blog posts
   - Link LinkedIn to GitHub

5. **Track What Works:**
   - Note which platforms drive traffic
   - Double down on successful formats
   - A/B test messaging
